words_data.definition: To successfully reach a goal by using effort or skill.
An agreement between two people; also something bought at a low price.
To do something special for an important or happy event.
Harm or injury that makes something less useful or valuable.
Facts or information that prove something is true.
Well known from being seen or experienced before.
A formal promise that something will be done or fixed.
The time of year when crops are gathered from the fields.
The power to change how someone thinks or behaves.
A daily record of news, events, or personal thoughts.
Information and understanding gained through learning.
A substance that flows freely, like water or oil.
Very large, important, or serious.
Showing the bad side of something; less than zero.
To watch carefully to learn about something.
A short period of time when something stops.
A group of words taken from a book or speech and repeated.
Happening in a short time or at great speed.
A piece of art made by shaping stone, wood, or metal.
A great victory or achievement.
All of space and everything in it.
Of many different kinds or types.
A person who sees an event happen.
The time of life when a person is young.
Belonging to a time very long ago in history.
Lasting for only a short period of time.
A state of physical ease or freedom from pain.
A small part of something larger.
The set of tools needed for a particular job.
Happening often or many times.
A very quick look at something.
The line where the earth and sky seem to meet.
Happening immediately; a very short moment.
The act of traveling from one place to another.
Everything you can see when looking across an area of land.
Information sent from one person to another.
Easy to see or feel; attracting attention.
The final result of an event or process.
A painting, drawing, or photograph of a person.
Worthy of attention; extraordinary.
A piece of jewelry worn around the wrist.
A person or animal that is kept as a prisoner.
A situation where a difficult choice has to be made.
To explode or break out suddenly.
Easily broken or damaged.
Real and exactly what it seems to be; not fake.
Parallel to the ground; flat and level.
To receive money or traits from someone after they die.
Having rough, sharp points or edges.
A unit of length equal to 1,000 meters.
The quality of being faithful and giving constant support.
Playful behavior that causes trouble but not serious harm.
To formally suggest someone for a job or an award.
Very bold, unusual, or shocking.
Very accurate and exact.
An angry argument or disagreement.
A small remaining part of something.
The state of being firm, steady, and not likely to change.
A tool used to see things that are far away in space.
A tool used in a house, especially in the kitchen.
Full of energy, life, or bright color.
To fight by holding and throwing someone without hitting.
The outer surface or outside part of something.
To produce something; also to let others go first in traffic.
An area that has a particular use or characteristic.
A strong desire to achieve something great.
A severe snowstorm with high winds.
To tell someone you are happy for their success.
To say something in an official or certain way.
Safe or fit to be eaten.
To grow or develop in a healthy and strong way.
Moving in a smooth and beautiful way.
A danger or risk that could cause harm.
Exactly the same in every way.
Great comfort and expensive living.
A field of grass, often with wild flowers.
To provide food or things needed for growth.
Something that blocks your path or makes progress difficult.
Something done in advance to prevent danger or problems.
A large lake used as a source of water supply.
An object that moves around a larger object in space.
Doing something carefully and with great attention to detail.
Relating to a city or town.
Empty and available to be used.
Found or happening over a large area.
Good enough for what is needed.
Extremely clever or very bright and shiny.
The result or effect of an action.
To live in a specified place.
Dealing with the simplest or most basic parts of something.
The base that supports a building; also a starting idea.
The feeling of being thankful and appreciative.
Showing extreme courage and bravery.
Extremely large or great in size.
A special anniversary, especially a 25th or 50th one.
Highly developed (like senses) or very interested.
A person who works in and manages a library.
To be filled with wonder or astonishment.
A person, thing, or situation that is annoying.
A chance to do something positive.
To go into or through something.
A long search for something difficult to find.
Relating to the countryside rather than the city.
An item kept as a reminder of a place or event.
Lasting for only a limited period of time.
The only one of its kind; unlike anything else.
Pointing straight up and down.
The health, happiness, and well-being of a person or group.
Existing in large quantities; more than enough.
A line that marks the edge of an area.
Goods carried on a ship, aircraft, or motor vehicle.
The events that will happen to a person in the future.
A long journey organized for a specific purpose.
The extreme limit of settled land or knowledge.
When a seed begins to grow and put out shoots.
To spend the winter in a deep sleep (for animals).
To light up or make something visible.
A particular point in events or time.
To start a fire or to inspire an interest/emotion.
The distance of a place north or south of the equator.
Seasonal movement of animals from one region to another.
To plan and direct the route or course of a vehicle.
A formal speech given on a special occasion.
A person who is among the first to explore a new area.
One part of something that is divided into four parts.
Able to be trusted; dependable.
A plan of action designed to achieve a goal.
A belief or custom passed down through generations.
Doing something at the same time as others; together.
A long journey involving travel by sea or in space.
A word used to show a contrast between two things.
An account of someone's life written by another person.
A series of planned actions to achieve a social or political goal.
A form of a language spoken in a specific area.
Detailed and complicated in design or explanation.
A mathematical rule or a set of ingredients.
The force that pulls objects toward each other.
When parts are arranged to be pleasing; peaceful agreement.
To catch fire or cause to catch fire.
Danger of loss, harm, or failure.
A toy tube containing mirrors and colored glass that creates patterns.
Something handed down from the past.
A group of atoms bonded together; the smallest unit of a substance.
Not helping or supporting either side in a conflict.
The curved path of a celestial object around a star or planet.
The study of matter, energy, and how they interact.
An action performed in response to a situation.
A band of colors, like in a rainbow.
An idea or set of ideas intended to explain something.
The speed of something in a given direction.
A person learning a craft from a skilled employer.
A legal member of a country or city.
A piece of written, printed, or electronic matter providing info.
Having the right to do or obtain something.
Having happened or existed in the past.
The origin or mode of formation of something.
Extremely funny and causing loud laughter.
A space, amount, or time that has no end.
Relating to young people or nature.
The sum of a person's actions, seen as deciding their fate.
A law or set of laws suggested by a government.
Fully developed physically; behaving like an adult.
Taking no side in an argument or war.
The state of being preoccupied with something constantly.
To convince someone to do or believe something.
Closely connected or appropriate to what is being discussed.
A thing kept as a reminder of a place visited.
A particular way of carrying out a task; a skill.
Being the best or most extreme example of its kind.
Behavior showing high moral standards.
A room or building where goods are manufactured or repaired.
The equipment needed for a particular activity or experiment.
Able to be decayed naturally by bacteria.
Able to exist or occur together without conflict.
A straight line passing through the center of a circle.
A biological community of interacting organisms and their environment.
A substance added to soil to help plants grow.
Relating to the internal heat of the earth.
A proposed explanation based on limited evidence; a starting point.
A room or building used for scientific research and experiments.
The capital or chief city of a country or region.
A substance that provides nourishment essential for growth.
An individual animal, plant, or single-celled life form.
A rate, number, or amount in each hundred.
A fixed share or amount that someone is allowed or required to have.
Not depleted when used; capable of being replaced naturally.
Interaction between two different organisms living in close association.
Large-scale processes affecting the structure of the earth's crust.
Light that has a shorter wavelength than visible light.
A mass of whirling fluid or air, especially a whirlpool or whirlwind.
An uncultivated and uninhabited region.
Detailed examination of the elements or structure of something.
A design plan or technical drawing.
To determine an amount or number mathematically.
A measurable extent of some kind, such as length, breadth, depth.
A person who designs, builds, or maintains engines or structures.
A numerical quantity that is not a whole number (e.g., 1/2).
The branch of mathematics concerned with shapes and space.
A plane figure with six straight sides and six angles.
A whole number; a number that is not a fraction.
The continuous line forming the boundary of a closed figure.
A four-sided figure.
A straight line from the center to the edge of a circle.
A fact or piece of data from a study of a large quantity of numerical data.
A plane figure with three straight sides and three angles.
The amount of space that a substance or object occupies.
The time at which something is most powerful or successful; high point.
A change by which an organism becomes better suited to its environment.
Disguising people or things to make them blend in with surroundings.
An animal that feeds on flesh/meat.
A green pigment in plants responsible for the absorption of light.
Shedding its leaves annually (like certain trees).
The process of turning from liquid into vapor.
The natural home or environment of an animal or plant.
The active immature form of an insect.
The process of transformation from an immature form to an adult.
Active at night and sleeping during the day.
An animal or person that eats food of both plant and animal origin.
An animal that naturally preys on others.
An action performed without conscious thought as a response to a stimulus.
The two times in the year when the sun reaches its highest or lowest point.
The region between the Tropics of Cancer and Capricorn.
An animal of a large group distinguished by having a backbone.
A minor change or addition designed to improve a text or piece of legislation.
A body of high-ranking officials who advise a head of state.
The national legislative body of a country.
A formal discussion on a particular topic in a public meeting.
A system of government by the whole population; voting.
The branch of government responsible for carrying out laws.
Relating to a system of government where power is shared between central and state gov.
To conduct the policy, actions, and affairs of a state.
Fair behavior or treatment; a judge in a high court.
The state of being free within society from oppressive restrictions.
A statue or building built to commemorate a person or event.
Propose or formally enter as a candidate for election.
A formal written request signed by many people.
A state in which supreme power is held by the people and elected reps.
The smaller, upper assembly in the US Congress or other legislatures.
An area of land under the jurisdiction of a ruler or state.
A formally concluded and ratified agreement between countries.
A union or association formed for mutual benefit between countries.
A system of government where most decisions are made by state officials.
A person who applies for a job or is nominated for election.
Relating to ordinary citizens and their concerns.
Provide with written evidence to support.
Relating to the system of voting in an election.
Marking the beginning of an institution, activity, or period of office.
Having the power to make laws.
The greater number; more than half.
A strong supporter of a party, cause, or person.
Sign or give formal consent to a treaty, making it valid.
Possessing supreme or ultimate power; a king/queen.
The right to vote in political elections.
A court of justice or a seat or court of justice.
A constitutional right to reject a decision made by a law-making body.
A group of islands.
A large waterfall; also a medical condition in the eye.
One of the world's main continuous expanses of land.
A triangular tract of sediment at the mouth of a river.
A long, narrow, deep inlet of the sea between high cliffs.
A slowly moving mass or river of ice formed by snow on mountains.
An area of high or mountainous land.
A narrow strip of land with sea on either side, linking two larger areas.
Distance of a place north or south of the equator.
Distance of a place east or west of the meridian at Greenwich.
The region of the earth's interior between the crust and the core.
A fertile spot in a desert where water is found.
A piece of land almost surrounded by water or projecting into it.
An area of relatively level high ground.
A crack, split, or break in something; a geological valley.
A river or stream flowing into a larger river or lake.
Plants considered collectively, especially those found in a particular area.
A poem or song narrating a story in short stanzas.
A factual written account of important or historical events.
A solid geometric figure with straight parallel sides and a circular base.
A line of hereditary rulers of a country.
A heraldic device or symbolic object as a distinctive badge.
Develop rapidly and successfully; thrive.
A very hard, granular, igneous rock.
A stylized picture of an object representing a word or sound.
Provide with pictures; explain by using examples.
A professional joker or 'fool' at a medieval court.
A country or state ruled by a king or queen.
A traditional story sometimes regarded as historical but unauthenticated.
Relating to the Middle Ages.
Belonging to a hereditary class with high social or political status.
A priest or priestess acting as a medium for advice from the gods.
A stiff, flat, thin material made from animal skin used for writing.
A long or arduous search for something.
An object surviving from an earlier time, especially one of historical interest.
A military operation in which enemy forces surround a town to force surrender.
A piece of thick textile fabric with pictures used as a wall hanging.
Make or become united, uniform, or whole.
Scandinavian seafaring pirates and traders who raided NW Europe.
A brave or experienced soldier or fighter.
A place of study or training in a special field.
A person who has a first degree from a university; also an unmarried man.
A senior state or legal official; head of a university.
A certificate awarded by an educational body for a course of study.
Having the right to do or obtain something; satisfying conditions.
The teaching staff of a university or college.
A person who has successfully completed a course of study or training.
Given as an honor without the usual requirements.
A society or organization having a particular object, especially scientific.
An educational talk to an audience, especially students.
Each of the 100 equal groups into which a population can be divided.
Be entitled to a particular benefit or privilege by fulfilling a condition.
A grant or payment made to support a student's education.
A sum of money charged for teaching or instruction by a school.
An educational institution designed for instruction and research.
A student who delivers the farewell address at a graduation ceremony.
The scientific study of plants.
A substance that increases the rate of a chemical reaction.
An insoluble substance that is the main part of plant cell walls.
Having normal physical functions suspended or slowed for a period; asleep.
The chemical breakdown of a substance by bacteria or yeast.
The development of a plant from a seed or spore after a period of dormancy.
The art or practice of garden cultivation and management.
The process of growing plants in sand, gravel, or liquid, without soil.
Not consisting of or deriving from living matter.
Relating to or consisting of molecules.
An individual animal, plant, or single-celled life form.
The process by which green plants use sunlight to synthesize foods.
A fine powdery substance from the male part of a flower.
The action of breathing; also cell-level energy production.
Matter that settles to the bottom of a liquid.
A tiny cell that is able to grow into a new plant or fungus.
The combination of ideas or components to form a connected whole.
The quality of being toxic or poisonous.
The process of water movement through a plant and its evaporation.
Relating to the plant tissues that conduct water and sap.
To become limp through heat, loss of water, or disease.
A medicine that inhibits the growth of or destroys microorganisms.
A chemical element that is essential for healthy bones and teeth.
A unit of energy often used to measure the energy value of food.
A substance found in food (like bread/pasta) that provides energy.
A fatty substance found in the body; too much can be bad for the heart.
The process by which the body breaks down food into nutrients.
A substance produced by a living organism that acts as a catalyst.
The chemical processes that occur within a living organism to maintain life.
A solid inorganic substance of natural occurrence; also a food nutrient.
A substance that provides nourishment essential for growth and life.
A substance found in meat, eggs, and beans that helps build body tissue.
Organic molecules that are essential for normal growth and health.
An artificial channel for conveying water, typically in the form of a bridge.
A group of people gathered together in one place for a common purpose.
The activity of buying and selling, especially on a large scale.
A heavy building material made from a mixture of broken stone or sand.
An area of a country or city, especially one regarded as a unit.
A sovereign ruler of great power and rank; ruler of an empire.
A place, meeting, or medium where ideas can be exchanged; public square.
The basic physical structures (e.g., roads, power) needed for society.
The action or process of innovating; a new method or idea.
A picture or pattern produced by arranging small colored pieces of glass.
An aristocrat or nobleman; a member of the high class in Ancient Rome.
The study of the fundamental nature of knowledge and reality.
A principal administrative division of certain countries or empires.
Conditions relating to public health, especially clean water and sewage.
The art of making two- or three-dimensional figures.
The study of the nature of God and religious belief.
The study of human history through the excavation of sites and artifacts.
An object made by a human being, typically one of historical interest.
Made of clay and hardened by heat.
The stage of human social development that is considered most advanced.
Make a hole or channel by digging; carefully uncover buried remains.
A primate of a family that includes humans and their fossil ancestors.
The period of history following the Bronze Age when iron tools were used.
A dunghill or refuse heap; a site for archaeological trash.
Relating to the later part of the Stone Age (farming/polished stone tools).
The branch of science concerned with fossil animals and plants.
Relating to the period before written records.
An object surviving from an earlier time.
A place where people establish a community.
The branch of geology concerned with the order and relative position of strata.
A device or implement used to carry out a particular function.
A quantity of precious metals, gems, or other valuable objects.
A state of disorder due to absence or nonrecognition of authority.
An act of sealing off a place to prevent goods or people from entering.
Soldiers who fought on horseback (historically).
Soldiers who fight on foot.
A movement or series of moves requiring skill and care.
A military force that is raised from the civil population in an emergency.
The highest legislature, consisting of the sovereign and elected reps.
A member of an armed group formed to fight secretly against an enemy.
A special right or advantage granted only to a particular person or group.
Military observation of a region to locate an enemy.
Formally declare one's abandonment of a claim, right, or possession.
Surrounding a place with armed forces to force it to surrender.
A formally concluded and ratified agreement between countries.
An act of defeating an enemy or opponent in a battle or game.
Loyalty or commitment of a subordinate to a superior or of an individual to a cause.
A surprise attack by people lying in wait in a concealed position.
Large-caliber guns used in warfare on land.
An improvised barrier erected to prevent or delay movement.
A large body of troops ready for battle, typically forming part of a brigade.
A line that marks the limits of an area; a dividing line.
Cease to resist an opponent or an unwelcome demand; surrender.
A person killed or injured in a war or accident.
A fortress, typically on high ground, protecting or dominating a city.
An officer of high rank in the army, above a lieutenant colonel.
A formal or explicit statement or announcement.
The action of forming or process of being formed; a structure.
A line or border separating two countries.
The troops stationed in a fortress or town to defend it.
Property that is or may be inherited; an inheritance.
The state of being independent; self-governance.
An amount of money or property left to someone in a will.
A public declaration of policy and aims, especially before an election.
A small military camp at a distance from the main army.
A public or official announcement, especially one dealing with a matter of importance.
A system for detecting the presence, direction, or speed of aircraft/ships.
Cease resistance to an enemy or opponent and submit to their authority.
A stretch of land, especially with regard to its physical features.
An area of land under the jurisdiction of a ruler or state.
An agreement between enemies or opponents to stop fighting for a certain time.
A person who freely offers to take part in an enterprise or undertake a task.
The properties or qualities of a room or building that determine how sound is transmitted.
The maximum extent of a vibration or oscillation.
The curved sickle shape of the waxing or waning moon.
A unit used to measure the intensity of a sound.
A sound caused by the reflection of sound waves from a surface back to the listener.
The rate at which something occurs or is repeated over a particular period.
The force that attracts a body toward the center of the earth.
Relating to or characterized by musical harmony.
A tendency to do nothing or to remain unchanged; resistance to change in motion.
A measure of 1,000 watts of electrical power.
Full of or shedding light; bright or shining, especially in the dark.
A piece of iron or other material that has its component atoms so ordered that it exhibits magnetism.
A subatomic particle of about the same mass as a proton but without an electric charge.
Move or swing back and forth at a regular speed.
A weight hung from a fixed point so that it can swing freely back and forth.
A massive and extremely remote celestial object, emitting exceptionally large amounts of energy.
The quality in a sound of being deep, full, and echoing.
A band of colors, as seen in a rainbow, produced by separation of light.
Cause something to pass on from one place or person to another.
Of or involving sound waves with a frequency above the upper limit of human hearing.
A continuous slight shaking movement.
The distance between successive crests of a wave, especially points in a sound wave.
The scientific study of the behavior, structure, physiology, classification, and distribution of animals.
The ability or tendency to float in water or air or some other fluid.
Any of the fine branching blood vessels that form a network between the arterioles and venules.
Water that collects as droplets on a cold surface when humid air is in contact with it.
The movement caused within a fluid by the tendency of hotter material to rise.
Become or cause to become incorporated into a liquid so as to form a solution.
The resistance that one surface or object encounters when moving over another.
The amount of water vapor in the atmosphere or in a gas.
Protect something by interposing material that prevents the loss of heat or the passage of electricity.
A group of atoms bonded together, representing the smallest fundamental unit of a chemical compound.
Combine or become combined chemically with oxygen.
A measure of acidity or alkalinity of water-soluble substances.
Cause a substance to be deposited in solid form from a solution.
The emission of energy as electromagnetic waves.
The state or process that occurs when no more of something can be absorbed, combined with, or added.
Able to be dissolved, especially in water.
The degree or intensity of heat present in a substance or object.
Convert or be converted into vapor.
An interview for a particular role or job as a singer, actor, dancer, or musician.
In or to the area behind the stage and especially in the dressing rooms of a theater.
A picture, description, or imitation of a person in which certain striking characteristics are exaggerated.
The sequence of steps and movements in dance or figure skating.
A room with a glass roof and walls; also a college for the study of classical music or other arts.
A piece of material suspended as a screen in a theater or window.
Conversation between two or more people as a feature of a book, play, or movie.
The action of improvising; creating something without preparation.
The text of an opera or other long vocal work.
A performance in a theater or a showing of a movie that takes place in the daytime.
A sequence of single notes that is musically satisfying.
A large group of musicians playing different instruments together.
A dramatic entertainment in which performers express meaning through gestures accompanied by music.
A stock of plays, dances, or pieces that a company or a performer knows or is prepared to perform.
The written text of a play, movie, or broadcast.
An act of speaking one's thoughts aloud when by oneself or regardless of any hearers, especially by a character in a play.
An elaborate musical composition for full orchestra, typically in four movements.
A brief evocative description, account, or episode.
